metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15562 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Roundcube Webmail before 1.2.11, 1.3.x before 1.3.14, and 1.4.x before 1.4.7. It allows XSS via a crafted HTML e-mail message, as demonstrated by a JavaScript payload in the xmlns (aka XML namespace) attribute of a HEAD element when an SVG element exists.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: roundcube package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
